trans-unit.source: Set password expiration policies in Azure Active Directory | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Set password expiration policies in Azure Active Directory | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to check expiration policies and change user password expiration either singly or in bulk for Azure Active directory passwords
trans-unit.target: Learn how to check expiration policies and change user password expiration either singly or in bulk for Azure Active directory passwords

trans-unit.source: Set password expiration policies in Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Set password expiration policies in Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This topic provides online help content for cloud services, such as Microsoft Intune and Office 365, which rely on Microsoft Azure Active Directory for identity and directory services.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This topic provides online help content for cloud services, such as Microsoft Intune and Office 365, which rely on Microsoft Azure Active Directory for identity and directory services.

trans-unit.source: As a global administrator for a Microsoft cloud service, you can use the Microsoft Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell to set up user passwords not to expire.
trans-unit.target: As a global administrator for a Microsoft cloud service, you can use the Microsoft Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell to set up user passwords not to expire.

trans-unit.source: You can also use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to remove the never-expires configuration, or to see which user passwords are set up not to expire.
trans-unit.target: You can also use Windows PowerShell cmdlets to remove the never-expires configuration, or to see which user passwords are set up not to expire.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Only passwords for user accounts that are not synchronized through directory synchronization can be configured not to expire.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Only passwords for user accounts that are not synchronized through directory synchronization can be configured not to expire.

trans-unit.source: For more information about directory synchronization, see the list of topics in [Directory synchronization roadmap](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh967642.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about directory synchronization, see the list of topics in [Directory synchronization roadmap](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh967642.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To use Windows PowerShell cmdlets, you first must install them.
trans-unit.target: To use Windows PowerShell cmdlets, you first must install them.

trans-unit.source: What do you want to do?
trans-unit.target: What do you want to do?

trans-unit.source: How to check expiration policy for a password
trans-unit.target: How to check expiration policy for a password

trans-unit.source: Set a password to expire
trans-unit.target: Set a password to expire

trans-unit.source: Set a password so that it will not expire
trans-unit.target: Set a password so that it will not expire

trans-unit.source: How to check expiration policy for a password
trans-unit.target: How to check expiration policy for a password

trans-unit.source: Connect to Windows PowerShell using your company administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Windows PowerShell using your company administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: Do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: To see whether a single user’s password is set to never expire, run the following cmdlet by using the user principal name (UPN) (for example, aprilr@contoso.onmicrosoft.com) or the user ID of the user you want to check: `Get-MSOLUser -UserPrincipalName <user ID> | Select PasswordNeverExpires`
trans-unit.target: To see whether a single user’s password is set to never expire, run the following cmdlet by using the user principal name (UPN) (for example, aprilr@contoso.onmicrosoft.com) or the user ID of the user you want to check: `Get-MSOLUser -UserPrincipalName <user ID> | Select PasswordNeverExpires`

trans-unit.source: To see the "Password never expires" setting for all users, run the following cmdlet: `Get-MSOLUser | Select UserPrincipalName, PasswordNeverExpires`
trans-unit.target: To see the "Password never expires" setting for all users, run the following cmdlet: `Get-MSOLUser | Select UserPrincipalName, PasswordNeverExpires`

trans-unit.source: Set a password to expire
trans-unit.target: Set a password to expire

trans-unit.source: Connect to Windows PowerShell using your company administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Windows PowerShell using your company administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: Do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: To set the password of one user so that the password will expire, run the following cmdlet by using the user principal name (UPN) or the user ID of the user: `Set-MsolUser -UserPrincipalName <user ID> -PasswordNeverExpires \$false`
trans-unit.target: To set the password of one user so that the password will expire, run the following cmdlet by using the user principal name (UPN) or the user ID of the user: `Set-MsolUser -UserPrincipalName <user ID> -PasswordNeverExpires \$false`

trans-unit.source: To set the passwords of all users in the organization so that they will expire, use the following cmdlet: `Get-MSOLUser | Set-MsolUser -PasswordNeverExpires \$false`
trans-unit.target: To set the passwords of all users in the organization so that they will expire, use the following cmdlet: `Get-MSOLUser | Set-MsolUser -PasswordNeverExpires \$false`

trans-unit.source: Set a password to never expire
trans-unit.target: Set a password to never expire

trans-unit.source: Connect to Windows PowerShell using your company administrator credentials.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Windows PowerShell using your company administrator credentials.

trans-unit.source: Do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: To set the password of one user to never expire, run the following cmdlet by using the user principal name (UPN) or the user ID of the user: `Set-MsolUser -UserPrincipalName <user ID> -PasswordNeverExpires \$true`
trans-unit.target: To set the password of one user to never expire, run the following cmdlet by using the user principal name (UPN) or the user ID of the user: `Set-MsolUser -UserPrincipalName <user ID> -PasswordNeverExpires \$true`

trans-unit.source: To set the passwords of all the users in an organization to never expire, run the following cmdlet: `Get-MSOLUser | Set-MsolUser -PasswordNeverExpires \$true`
trans-unit.target: To set the passwords of all the users in an organization to never expire, run the following cmdlet: `Get-MSOLUser | Set-MsolUser -PasswordNeverExpires \$true`
